channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Maine's food pantries stare down volunteer shortage while anticipating cuts
item.description: Maine has long been one of the most food insecure states in New England. In March, the Trump administration cut more than $1 billion from two U.S. food programs.
item.content:encoded:
Maine has long been one of the most food insecure states in New England. In March, the Trump administration cut more than $1 billion from two U.S. food programs.

(Image credit: Katherine Emery/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
item.description: In Mexico, September means chiles en nogada season. But one key ingredient, a candied barrel cactus called biznaga, is now illegal because it's vanishing in the wild.
item.content:encoded:
In Mexico, September means chiles en nogada season. But one key ingredient, a candied barrel cactus called biznaga, is now illegal because it's vanishing in the wild.

(Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell)
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Why friends are teaming up to buy homes
item.description: Buying a home is a conventional milestone for couples. But as home prices skyrocket, many Americans are buying homes with someone who isn't their romantic partner.
item.content:encoded:
Buying a home is a conventional milestone for couples. But as home prices skyrocket, many Americans are buying homes with someone who isn't their romantic partner.

(Image credit: Via Hayley Currier and Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Rhaina Cohen

item.title: DACA has bipartisan support in Congress. Still, Republicans are following Trump's lead
item.description: President Trump failed to revoke DACA in his first term and his focus on immigration this time has mostly ignored the policy. Still, Republican lawmakers are deferring to the president on the issue.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump failed to revoke DACA in his first term and his focus on immigration this time has mostly ignored the policy. Still, Republican lawmakers are deferring to the president on the issue.

(Image credit: Leigh Vogel)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Large Russian drone and missile attack on Kyiv kills 4 and wounds at least 10
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the large-scale attacks involved nearly 500 strike drones.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the large-scale attacks involved nearly 500 strike drones.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Stampede at a political rally for popular actor Vijay in southern India kills 36, injures 40
item.description: A stampede at a rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu killed at least 36 people and injured 40 others.
item.content:encoded:
A stampede at a rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu killed at least 36 people and injured 40 others.

(Image credit: Uncredited)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: UN imposes 'snapback' sanctions on a hungrier, poorer and more anxious Iran
item.description: The United Nations reimposed sanctions on Iran early Sunday over its nuclear program, further squeezing the Islamic Republic as its people increasingly find themselves priced out of the food they need to survive and worried about their futures.
item.content:encoded:
The United Nations reimposed sanctions on Iran early Sunday over its nuclear program, further squeezing the Islamic Republic as its people increasingly find themselves priced out of the food they need to survive and worried about their futures.

(Image credit: Vahid Salemi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Wyoming town erects new monument to violent, anti-immigrant history
item.description: At a time when President Trump is going after foreign laborers in the U.Ss, and saying unflattering accounts of U.S. history should be removed, Rock Springs, Wyoming has put up a new monument to ethnic violence there.
item.content:encoded:
At a time when President Trump is going after foreign laborers in the U.Ss, and saying unflattering accounts of U.S. history should be removed, Rock Springs, Wyoming has put up a new monument to ethnic violence there.

(Image credit: Jenna McMurtry)
item.dc:creator: Jenna McMurtry

item.title: George E. Hardy, Tuskegee Airman, dies at 100
item.description: George E. Hardy was the youngest Red Tail fighter pilot at 19 years old and completed 21 missions across Europe during World War II.
item.content:encoded:
George E. Hardy was the youngest Red Tail fighter pilot at 19 years old and completed 21 missions across Europe during World War II.

(Image credit: Senior Airman Malcolm Mayfield)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Marc Maron, Human Rights Watch and others slam Saudi comedy festival
item.description: The participation of big name funnymen, including Dave Chappelle, Aziz Ansari and Kevin Hart, provoked criticism from fellow comedians and human rights groups.
item.content:encoded:
The participation of big name funnymen, including Dave Chappelle, Aziz Ansari and Kevin Hart, provoked criticism from fellow comedians and human rights groups.

(Image credit: Amy Sussman/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman
